inn1.comm: outside off, hint of movement back into the batsman and it's left alone
fuller on off stump, driven firmly down the ground to the off side and but mid-off is quite straight
pushed across and left alone
a touch wider outside off and he shoulders arms
pitched up fuller, Warner comes forward and pushes towards mid-off
good line outside off stump and he opts not to play again
what a beauty to start with...full outside off and it draws Wade forward who then plays and misses with a drive
and again! Beaten two in two. Some pace on that from Finn as Wade launches into a drive and the ball beats the edge
full on middle and off, gets a good stride in and blocks to mid-off
back of a length and this one nips back into the left hander who is taken at the top of the pads
this jars the splice as Wade plays it towards square leg and takes one hand off the bat
dragged a little short and wide but Warner can't take advantage as he flashes and misses at a cut
a cracker...completely squares up Wade as this swings in then seams away past the outside. Almost too good
full on middle and off, searching stuff from Anderson, Wade presses forward and defends
full outside off, carries through at ankle height to Kieswetter
short of a length at the body, Wade defends a touch awkwardly off the back foot
how do you play that? Beats the outside edge again with late movement from a full length and Wade is left prodding
squared up by a ball starting around leg stump that he tried to work through the on side and a leading edge rolls into the off side
extravagant seam movement and bounce as Warner is beaten playing another cut...but it's a fraction too wide
now beaten on the front foot by a full delivery...this is fantastic bowling
finally, they get one away and it's a very pleasing drive from Warner as he punches a full delivery straight past mid-off
wider outside off stump
whipped away from middle and leg down to long leg
very full, yorker-length on the popping crease, squeezed out to the off side
full on middle and off, solidly defended back to the bowler
pitching around middle and leg, straightens on Warner who ends up playing it chest on due to the late swing
a touch shorter and Warner hops into the back foot to work it through midwicket
worked off leg stump to midwicket
full on off stump, brings Wade forward and he drives sweetly but straight to mid-off
another one scoots past the edge - already been plenty of them - as this seams away on off stump
behind the line this time and defended back to the bowler
full and dug out back to the bowler
another crackerjack! Bounces and seams away from off stump and Warner doesn't have a hope of playing it
finds somewhere near the middle of the back this time, short of a length and punched to cover
back on a full length and another punchy drive finds mid-off
straighter this time and a well-timed flick goes straight to midwicket
edged! Batsmen need some luck in these conditions and Warner finds some as he Chinese cuts past the stumps and a diving Kieswetter...the delivery nipped back into him to cramp him for room
defends with an open face to backward point and they scramble a single which leaves Warner diving for his ground
pulled down shorter and it's whipped away through square leg
nicely played, short again and Warner helps it behind square on the leg side with a pull which beats deep square-leg
good reply! Jags back to beat Warner on the inside edge as he tries to play through the off side
opens the face off the back foot and the ball just evades a diving backward point
full on off stump, opens the face down to third man
starts back of a length and it is punched to cover...a cross-seam delivery from Broad
nips back into the Wade from a good length and it's driven to point
full and swinging into the pads, Wade misses out as he doesn't connect
dropped Anderson has shelled one at slip...Wade went hard at the ball and edged at a good height just to Anderson's left so he had to move a bit but should have held it
full on middle and leg, played to mid-on
dropped into the off side and that's a well-judged single
well played by Warner who is starting benefit from the hard graft as he drives through the off side and Bopara can't quite haul it in
full again at the stumps, punched firmly towards mid-on who is fairly deep and allowing the single
outside off and left alone
edged! Did it carry to Tredwell at second slip? Yes, it looks as though it just got there so that goes down as another drop. Was a tough, low, catch but he seemed a little slow to move
full and driven with a crunch to mid-off
that's a wild swing by Warner as he tries to launch this over mid-on but only connects with fresh air
that's middled! Plays the same shot and connects with power this time as he lofts Broad high of mid-on
pushed into the off side towards point
tries to give himself a bit of room to drive through the off side but only finds mid-off
loses his fine down the leg side so that's an extra ball
worked away from leg stump into square leg

dropped! Another one goes down and this time it's Samit Patel at third man as Warner goes up and over. Patel steadied himself under the catch but it was a pretty poor effort in the end. Cook is not impressed
round the wicket, tossed up and pushed to cover
on the stumps, clipped through midwicket
full, sliding down the leg side, goes back and taps to short fine leg

tossed up, misses with the sweep and gone! Warner often looks a little uncertain trying to work slower bowlers around and he falls to a plumb lbw decision, the ball was full and straightening on middle and he didn't get anything on it. Hawk Eye showing pretty big turn for Tredwell, suggesting the ball would have gone on to hit off
back over the wicket, on off, pushed square
flighted on the stumps, gets out and drives to long-on for a single to get off the mark
full and straight, Forrest is hit on the pad ... bit appeal but Dar had correctly spotted a thin inside edge. Broad having no luck today
pitched up again, Forrest gets forward and drives past mid-off
short ball, Wade tries to pull and swipes fresh air
length ball this time, angled across the left-hander who thrusts a pad at it and lets it through outside off
back of a length, Wade tries to play off his hips and the ball squirts into the off side
touch short and wide, cut on the back foot straight to point
pushed through outside off, forward nudge into the covers
length ball outside off, played back down the track
bit more flight, worked into the leg side
bit of spin back in from outside off, Forrest plays back and is hit on the pad, probably too high
on the stumps, worked towards square leg and Ravi Bopara fields sharply to prevent a run
full and on off, played back to the bowler - maiden from Tredwell
touch short of a length, Wade backs away and slaps a cut shot through point to the man in the deep
bouncer, well-directed at the batsman, who hoicks aerially through the vacant square leg area
fuller length, driven square through the infield
good length, straightening and Forrest is squared up trying to work to leg, gets a leading edge into the off side
full and straight, played back down the pitch to mid-on
short ball outside off, Forrest this time misses with a swish at Broad

they try for two to long-on, Tredwell takes the throw at the bowler's end and swings his arm behind his body to break the wicket ... Forrest is struggling here, yep, he's a few inches short. The batsmen were hustling, trying to put pressure on the fielders but it backfired and Forrest is felled
tossed up outside off, pushed into the covers

flighted, spinning past the bat as Wade advances and stumped! Lovely dismissal for Tredwell, who lured the struggling Wade out of his crease, beat him with the turn - in fact almost bowled him - and Kieswetter was alert to whip off the bails
full and on the stumps, whipped through midwicket to get off the mark first ball
tossed up and Clarke also uses his feet to clip one down the ground
flighted, Smith is on the walk again, chips slightly aerially past the diving Ian Bell at mid-on to the man on the boundary
touch short, worked through the leg side into a gap and they pick up two
pitched up outside off and Smith frees the arms, drives straight at extra-cover
length ball, gets forward and pushes wide of extra-cover, Smith calls one but Clarke sends him back ... and Bopara's shy misses, giving them an over-throw

dabbed towards point ... and a direct hit from Eoin Morgan runs out Clarke! Australia are in disarray here, trying to push for singles as England crowd round like vultures. Clarke ran the gauntlet but was left well short by an excellent throw as Morgan fielded on the bounce
length ball outside off, steps out and plays no stroke
short of a length and tucked into the leg side
on the stumps, pushed back down the track
flighted on off, Smith goes back and dabs through point, they think and then re-think about two
played on the front foot towards cover, another risky single but a misfield aids them
goes back and works one into the leg side
flighted on leg stump, straightening and takes a leading edge that loop through mid-off, Bopara can't quite get across from extra-cover to snaffle it
full and on the stumps, punched down the ground for one
full and straight, gets forward well in defence
slightly overpitched outside off, nicely timed drive back down the ground, bouncing over Finn and beating the dive at long-on
nudge off the pads, they chance a second and get it, bit of a misdirected throw from midwicket forces Kieswetter to take above his head
length ball on the stumps, forward defensive
bit of width, seams away a touch and beats Smith's outside edge as he dabbles at the ball away from his body
short ball, angling down leg and deflected smartly down to fine leg for another boundary
length ball, on off stump and straightening, goes back and chops through square leg
tossed up and driven down the ground for one
flighted on off stump, gets forward and pushes to the man at long-off
length, outside off, hangs back and dabs to short third man
flighted on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
tossed up and lofted over extra-cover, the sweeper has to run around and they get two
loosener, down the leg side - and Smith gets a tickle through to Kieswetter! Australia hit another bump in the road and that's a gimme for Bopara, whose gentle medium pace somehow foxed Smith
pitched up outside off, pushed on the front foot to cover
straighter line, worked off the legs towards mid-on
full and slightly wide, hit uppishly through the covers
bit of width again and cut through square this time
length ball, hangs back and slaps a cut shot to point on the bounce
tossed up on off, clipped back down the ground
flighted, comes forward and drives through mid-off to the man in the deep
touch short, straightening on the stumps, goes back and knocks into the leg side
flighted outside off stump, driven to long-off
full and clipped through the covers for one
tossed up outside off and driven square for another single

Bopara strikes again as Hussey feathers through to the keeper! It was another innocuous delivery, slightly short and wide, Hussey tried to dab it through the off side and nicked off. Bopara's golden arm could probably refloat the European economy right now
full and sliding across, thick edge down to third man
line and length around off, played back to the bowler
tight line on the stumps, defended on the back foot
fuller, ducking in a touch, can't beat mid-off with a drive
full, almost yorker length and punched short on the leg side
big appeal first ball as this takes the pad with Pattinson not far forward but it's probably missing leg stump
cuts and misses at one that bounces outside off
played to the leg side
flicked in the air, one bounce to long-on
full outside off, whipped with the turn past a diving midwicket

another big appeal for lbw. This is close and they review. It's pad first as Pattinson lunges forward. This will be tight. But the impact is umpires' call and it was also missing off stump. So excellent decision by Ian Gould
full outside off, driven to a deepish mid-off
tight on middle and off, Pattinson defends back to the bowler
no width on offer, defended to the off side
full toss outside off, Pattinson drives and got a thin edge but the ball went straight to ground through to Kieswetter
pulls the length back and it's defend to cover
play and miss outside off as Pattinson drives to end a very tight over
a fumble in the field gives Bailey a single...he drove against the spin and the inside edge bobbled to the leg side
round the wicket, driven down the on side and Tredwell can't reach it with a dive
tries to paddle this from way outside off stump but doesn't make contact
manages successfully this time and scoops it past the keeper through short fine-leg
inside edge into the pad leads to a stifled lbw appeal

big appeal, both for a catch and lbw I think, but it's not out to either. Plenty of turn for Tredwell as Pattinson played against the spin. The ball ended up a slip but not off the edge. It also pitched outside leg
full on off stump, pushed back to Bopara in his follow through
worked into midwicket for a very sharp single
chopped into the off side
good work at cover by Anderson as his dive cuts off any chance of a run from a nice-looking drive
a slower ball is edged down to third man
tucked from off stump down to long-on
uses his feet but can't beat midwicket
goes for a sweep from well outside off stump, gets a top edge but no one is catching at short fine-leg
swept firmly in front of deep square-leg
flicked along the ground through a straight midwicket to the man in the deep
flicked in the air but short of midwicket
goes for a cut and gets beaten on the bottom edge...not far from off stump
full length, shapes into Bailey who drives down to long-on to take Australia to three figures
short of a length and worked down to long leg
on off stump and pushed back to the bowler
full and nicely driven but he picks out mid-off on the edge of the circle
short ball, Pattinson arches his back and gives himself a touch of room to angle it down to third man

pinball out there...Bailey works it from outside off to midwicket, Pattinson raced up for a run but was sent back and a direct hit then sent the ball flying off to the deep so they take a single anyway
breaks free with a clean strike over long-on...strongly played
comes down the pitch again, takes the pad into the off side and can't get the single
worked along the deck to long-on
round the wicket, goes for a sweep and doesn't connect...gets taken on the pad outside off
flicked towards midwicket who can't stop it with a dive but Patel does well in the deep with a one-handed return
swept from outside off to deep square
on off stump, pushed into the off side and Finn can't cut off the run from his follow through
backs away to give himself room and carves a full delivery outside off over point
tries to go over the same area but this time it's short and beats the top edge
cuts again and gets a bottom edge that bobbles towards Kieswetter
bouncer from Finn and it's pulled with pretty good control down to fine leg

big appeal and not out...England are convinced Pattinson edged the slower ball as he heaved to leg. No reviews left for England. There was certainly a noise. Oh, hang on, the umpires are conferring about whether this has carried. So it could be out after all. This isn't a review, it's the umpires asking for the TV help. Everyone standing around. And he's out!. So Aleem Dar clearly heard an edge
opens the face and finds backward point
lovely shot, Bailey helps the ball backward of square on the leg side...was just a fraction short and he rolled his wrists nicely to beat deep square
back-to-back boundaries as he inside edges a full delivery past short fine-leg...Broad followed the batsman outside leg stump
back of a length and clubbed down to long-on
edged away, more useful runs for Australia as McKay plays away from the body and gets it wide of the keeper...no slips in the penultimate over
swing and a miss as he tries to clear the leg side
big appeal for lbw as Bailey moved across his stumps to try and go through the leg side and probably got outside the line of off stump...ooh, mighty close but just outside
flicked out to deep square-leg to give the strike back to Bailey
excellent delivery, saw the batsman moving to leg this time and following him which meant Bailey could only dig the yorker back to Anderson
that's a clean strike! Picked it up beautifully and launched it over long-on...been a very good innings from Bailey. Anderson just missed his length
slower, shorter ball outside off and Bailey doesn't make contact
and they close with another boundary as Bailey drills Anderson straight down the ground and he's given Australia something to bowl at

inn2.comm: back of a length, outside off and swinging away, no stroke
full and straight, Cook gets forward and nudges wide of mid-on for one
beauty from McKay, pitching on a length and holding its line, Bell comes forward and is beaten pat his outside edge
touch short and angling in towards the pads, tapped through a gap at midwicket and they get back for a second
back of a length and wide of the stumps this time, cut behind point, third man comes round but can't prevent another two

full and straight, Bell advances, clips off the pads straight to midwicket! Bailey takes it comfortably and that's a first failure for Bell in his latest incarnation as an opener. Slightly soft dismissal but an early wicket is just what Australia needed
good length, swinging back towards the stumps, Cook makes an astutely judged leave
pushed through outside off, no swing and that's a wide
full and wide of the stumps, leans out and drives square, well fielded at point by Warner
tighter line, played back down the pitch
solid forward defensive in front of off stump
yorker length, on the stumps, Cook does well to jam his bat down on it
pitched up, dropped short on the off side
drifts down the leg side, clipped in front of square and Bailey dives full length to stop it
leg-stump line, tucks Cook up and hits him on the pad - but it was high
pitched up outside off stump, drive towards mid-on comes off the toe of the bat
length ball outside off, no stroke from Cook
slightly full, on the pads and tipped in front of midwicket, Bailey hits at the non-striker's end and England pick up a second run as the ball deflects away
short and wide, Cook goes back and lacerates and late, back-foot drive through cover-point for the first boundary of the innings
short of a length and tapped towards point
on the stumps, shuffles across and pushes short on the leg side
length ball, on middle, punched to mid-on
touch short, steered behind point despite Warner flinging himself to his left
drifts down the leg side and that's meat and drink to Trott who whips it fine, McKay can't quite pull off a sliding stop on the boundary
length ball on off, defended back to the bowler
pitched up on the stumps, Cook stays back and the ball leaves him a touch and fizzes past the outside edge - unplayable
slightly wider, good length again, Cook leaves this one

teasing line again, there's a sound on the way through and Dar gives it - but Cook immediately reviews. He's confident he didn't hit the ball and replays show a big chunk of bat on pad; Hot Spot also indicates the ball didn't brush the edge and the decision is oveturned
line and length, sliding across, no stroke
on the stumps, slightly full, deflected behind square and they get one to remove Cook from McKay's crosshairs
length ball outside off, Trott lets it through
full and wide of the stumps, Cook doesn't need to play at that so he doesn't
tighter line, slightly back of a length, defended on to the pitch
slightly short, wide of off and Cook manufactures a crunchy cut shot in front of point, the ball skidding away to the boundary
defended in front of the stumps
length ball on the stump, dropped short on the leg side for a quick single
full and in the corridor, punched on the walk to mid-on
straight and slightly full, dabbed towards midwicket
touch short, wide of the stumps, Trott opens the face and tries to steer through gully but Smith reels it in
bouncer, at the batsman, Trott ducks underneath
fullish and wide of off, punched to extra-cover
pitched on a length outside off, bit of extra bounce and the ball comes off the splice towards cover
on the stumps, nudged into the leg side
smooth approach and delivery from Pattinson, line and length outside off and Cook leaves
touch fuller, Cook tries to drive and deflects the ball on to his front pad and away towards point
length ball, defended in front of off
length ball, on off, played back down the strip
pitched up, squirted in front of square on the off side, they put pressure on the fielder and steal one
full and wide, Trott rotates his wrists through a controlled cut shot, the ball scooting behind point, third man has no chance of getting round to cut it off
full and straight, defended in front of the stumps
full and sliced away along the ground down to third man
length ball outside off, pushed towards point
length ball, around the line of off, pushed to mid-on
banged in wide of the stumps, Trott makes no attempt to cut
another bumper - but this one is called wide on height
full and wide of off, Trott tries to shovel the ball into the leg side and his shot dies in front of mid-on
round the wicket, flighted outside off and played back to the bowler
tossed up and swept through deep backward square for one
over the wicket, pushed through on off and Trott is a bit late getting his bat down in defence

this one spins, beats Trott's sweep and bowls him! Clarke held it up a bit this time, Trott was through the shot and the ball gripped, straightened and rattled into the top of off. Nice bowling from the captain - if only he could trust the frontline left-arm spinner in his side to do the same!
tossed up and pushed defensively into the off side
flighted, outside the line of off, tapped through point and Bopara is off the mark
touch short, outside off and guided behind square on the off side for a couple
dragged short and wide, Bopara has to reach for it and chops the ball through the covers to the sweeper
round the wicket, spinning back in and chopped into the off side
tossed up outside off and swept hard through square to the man in the deep
floats this one up and it turns into a full toss which Bopara clips wide of mid-on
length ball, turning towards leg and Cook glances it fine, where Bailey does well to cut it off
tossed up and pushed towards mid-on
flighted, drifting down the leg side, turned fine for a single
drags his line down, straightening outside off, played back to the bowler
tossed up outside off stump, Bopara drives wristily through the covers
tossed up on the stumps and dabbed towards midwicket, who fields well
full and around the line of off, pushed back on the off side
tossed up, bit of air outside off, played towards mid-off
length, hit squarer this time through cover
tossed up on the stumps, clipped off the legs - they look for two but won't get it
flighted, outside off, guided to short third man
touch short, goes back and drives from in front of the stumps through cover
flighted outside off, played back to the bowler
opens the face with excellent placement through the off side to find a gap backward of square
driven off the back foot through the off side, touch short from Clarke
hint of width outside off and cut away backward point so this is turning into a good over for England
there's some power behind that shot from Bopara as he stands on leg stump and thumps a short ball in front of square on the off side with placement to beat deep cover
darted in very full and dug out into the off side
comes well outside off and defends to the leg side
goes for a sweep and is struck well outside off stump
steps back to a shorter ball and flicks through straight midwicket
worked with strong wrists through the leg side from a ball around middle and off
taken from way outside off with the turn and worked to short fine-leg who can't stop the single
angled in towards leg stump from round the wicket and it's flicked to midwicket
full on off stump, driven firmly into the covers
short outside off, Bopara has plans for a powerful pull through square leg but plays over the ball
short again and this time strikes Bopara in the stomach as he goes for a pull
fuller outside off, Bopara drives and gets a think inside edge to the leg side
neatly played, flipped off the back foot through midwicket
good yorker to end with which Bopara forces down the on-side of the pitch and wants a single but it's not on
connects strongly with a sweep and it races straight to deep square
gets down early and laps this round the corner from a wide off-stump line through fine leg
tries to do it again and this time is struck on the pad but well outside off
third in a row, this one bobbles off a bottom into big spaces on the leg side
fired it at leg stump and it's tucked along the ground past a diving midwicket
top shot! Tossed up outside off and Bopara drives powerful through the covers. He stayed on leg stump to open the off side and produced a strong flick of his wrists. Classy.
back of a length and punched sweetly to mid-off
nicely timed by Cook as he flicks off the back foot through midwicket but deep square can get around...too short from Pattinson
that's hammered. Short again from Pattinson and Cook doesn't need a second invitation as he crunches a pull which eludes a sprawling man in the deep
wide outside off this time and he's lucky to get away with it as Cook's stinging drive picks out Smith at cover
onto the front foot and opens the face to find a gap in the covers
back of a length outside off and punched to cover
starts with a poor delivery, short on leg stump and Cook steps inside the line to flick it effortlessly down to fine leg...easy pickings
gets half forward to a fuller delivery and drives off a think inside edge to the leg side
dropped in short and Bopara connects well with his hook but sends it straight in the direct of long leg
that's better, full on middle and off, defended to mid-on
left alone outside off
a strangled appeal as Cook plays forward and gets struck on the pad
starts short and is hammered with a pull to midwicket where Warner takes a blow
tossed up on leg stump and driven back to the bowler
short outside and cut very hard straight through cover so long-off has to run around
short again and pulled through square leg
now there's a full toss but Cook misses out as he clubs to midwicket
better ball to end with, wider outside off and defended to the off side
full outside off and Bopara doesn't time his drive to cover
that's crunched, it's clearly a decent bat, as Bopara comes into the front foot and drives with a free swing of the arms through the covers
blimey, he's drilled that but straight to cover who will having stinging hands
slower ball, well bowled, it takes an inside edge into the body and they run well
played off the back foot
tries to drive on the up through the off side but is beaten by some extra pace and bounce
starts outside leg stump and is swept firmly to deep square
full and wide outside off, Cook leans into a pleasing drive which gives deep cover plenty of work...Smith wanted him to stop the second
swung away through midwicket from outside off stump
fetches this from outside off and drags it down to long-on
tucked off middle and leg out to deep square to take him to a neat fifty from 69 balls
loses his shape a little as he tries to but it goes back to Smith
play and a miss as Cook drives at a full ball outside off
full on middle, dug out just to the left of mid-on which allows the single
full on off stump, jabbed into the off side
this takes the cue end of the bat as Bopara pulls a short ball and it loops safely over mid-on
driven through the off side to the sweeper and that's excellent running to make two from it...almost went straight to Hilfenhaus
a bouncer that's too short for Dar's liking and it's called wide...way over Bopara's head
goes full at off stump and it's driven firmly to mid-on
tossed up outside off, Cook goes down on one knee to sweep through square leg
pushed through outside off and Doherty extracts big spin, beating Bopara's stiff-legged push
straighter, fuller this time and Bopara sweeps expertly, timing the ball for four through deep backward square
tossed up and swept again, squarer this time and they take one to the fielder in the deep
tossed up outside off, heaved out into the deep, towards wide long-on, the ball bouncing a few yards in front of the man
flighted and swept hard again, superb effort from Forrest at deep backward square prevents a boundary
pitched up outside off, driven but doesn't connect cleanly and extra-cover comes in to field
banged in short and Bopara swivels on a sixpence to club a meaty hook shot over midwicket for a one-bounce for - terrific shot
length ball outside off, again Bopara frees the arms and crashes an uppish drive through extra-cover - there was a man there but he blinked and missed it
bumper, goes for another big pull shot but doesn't connect this time
length, wide of the stumps, goes back and plays a delicate glide, opening the face down to third man - that's a run-a-ball fifty for Bopara, who's gamboling around now
defended in front of off - Cook's not one to get carried away
takes the pace off it, turned to midwicket
on the stumps, slower ball again, worked through the infield on the leg side
length, sliding across, beats the outside edge as Cook has a dash
again Cook swings his arms, gets a big leading edge but it falls safely over cover
touch shorter, tight line and Cook nicks off to first slip. It was probably wasn't quite there either to cut or drive but Cook, in a hurry now, had a go and Clarke clung on
length delivery, touch wide of the stumps and Morgan wristily slaps his first ball in front of cover for a sensational boundary
short of a length and pulled into the ground on the leg side
length, on the stumps, dropped short of mid-on and they skip through for one
slower ball out the back of the hand, short of a length and Bopara mistimes his pull into the ground

length delivery, angling in on the stumps and Bopara misses the ball as he tries to close the face, hit on the back pat. Dar turns the appeal down but Clarke calls for the review ... and Hawk Eye shows the ball just shaving the bail, so it stays with the umpire's call and Bopara still has a chance to be there at the end
full and sliding across, beats Morgan's expansive drive
drifts down the leg side - wide
full and Morgan gets under the ball, carting it high into the night sky, towards long-on - it plops a few yards short of the rope and won't roll any further
pitched up outside off and launched high over the infield again - won't run all the way either but it's plenty good enough to wrap up a seven-wicket Duckworth-Lewis win
